Definition: In this task, you will be given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You will need to determine whether, as a result of the Head, PersonX may feel what is mentioned in the Tail or not. In this task, the feeling is an emotional reaction on the part of X or other participants in an event. For example, as a result of gift-giving, X might feel good about [one]self. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. As a result of the Head, PersonX will feels satisfied.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX becomes distracted<sep>Tail: They would suffer injuries too.
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, if PersonX becomes distracted, PersonX won't feel what is mentioned in the Tail. So this output is correct.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX finds PersonY's wallet<sep>Tail: glad to help someone get something back.
Positive Examples.explanation: If PersonX finds PersonY's wallet, personX will be glad to help someone get something back. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX accepts ___ in exchange<sep>Tail: to want to compromise
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX accepts something in exchange, PersonX will not feel what is mentioned in the Tail. So the output should be "No".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX projects PersonY image<sep>Tail: happy
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX projects PersonY image, as a result, PersonX may feel happy, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX never really liked ___<sep>Tail: that they didn't lose anything
Head: PersonX makes PersonY's skin crawl<sep>Tail: creepy
Head: PersonX accepts PersonY offer<sep>Tail: satisfied
Head: PersonX gives ___ to my friend<sep>Tail: kind
Head: PersonX calls PersonX's dentist<sep>Tail: caring of itself
Head: PersonX buys an apple<sep>Tail: satisfied
Head: PersonX files off the serial numbers<sep>Tail: guilty
Head: PersonX bears the brunt<sep>Tail: less stress
